SEARCH
Module org.postgresql.pljava.internal
Package org.postgresql.pljava.jdbc

Class SQLXMLImpl.XMLCopier

java.lang.Object
org.postgresql.pljava.jdbc.SQLXMLImpl.XMLCopier
Direct Known Subclasses:
SQLXMLImpl.XMLCopier.DOM, SQLXMLImpl.XMLCopier.SAX, SQLXMLImpl.XMLCopier.SAX.Parsing, SQLXMLImpl.XMLCopier.StAX, SQLXMLImpl.XMLCopier.Stream
Enclosing class:
SQLXMLImpl<V extends Datum>
abstract static class SQLXMLImpl.XMLCopier extends Object
Encapsulation of how to copy from one SQLXML to another.

In the case of a source SQLXML object that prefers to present its content as a StreamSource, obtain an instance with copierFor, passing the target SQLXML instance, the server character set and the encoding name peeked from any declaration at the front of the source stream. Then supply the DeclProbe object representing the peeked initial content, and the InputStream or Reader representing the rest of the source content, to the appropriate prepare method. The copy is completed by calling finish.

Between prepare and finish, parser restrictions can be adjusted if needed, using the Adjusting.XML.Source API on the object returned by getAdjustable.

For the cases of SQLXML objects that present their content as SAXSource, StAXSource, or DOMSource, there are no prepare methods, and getAdjustable returns a dummy object that doesn't adjust anything. When the source presents XML content in already-parsed form, there are no parser restrictions to adjust.

    (package private) static SQLXMLImpl.XMLCopier.Stream
    copierFor(SQLXMLImpl.Writable tgt, Charset tgtCS, String srcCSName)
    Return an XMLCopier that can copy a stream source that declares an encoding name srcCSName to a target whose character set is tgtCS (which is here strongly assumed to be the PostgreSQL server charset, so will not need to be remembered in the created XMLStreamCopier).
